text:
Lawmakers are frustrated that they can’t bring their fight over the killing of George Floyd to Congress right now. So they’re taking to the streets

name: politico
text:
The monthly jobs numbers for May are expected to show we’ve reached 20% unemployment, and that’s falling particularly hard on minorities. Fewer than half of black adults are now employed.

@renurayasam and @vtg look at how bad job numbers will get https://t.co/C48hU9KLdH https://t.co/BFkW58shUH

name: politico
text: What's really happening on Capitol Hill? Huddle up with @MZanona each morning to find out. Subscribe to POLITICO's essential guide to all things Congress. https://t.co/Xcj2lMABRb https://t.co/Yx5jl25OLt

name: politico
text:
Ousted State Department IG Steve Linick said he tried to interview Mike Pompeo about his role in an “emergency” arms sale to Saudi Arabia shortly before he was fired

https://t.co/xbzILPMIlS

name: politico
text:
Laurie O. Robinson helped lead the push to demilitarize police departments after Ferguson. Now, she’s worried that President Trump’s mishandling of peaceful demonstrators threatens to undo six years of progress

https://t.co/L8b4sPMg2X

name: politico
text:
California Gov. Gavin Newsom today forcefully rejected President Trump’s threat to quell unrest by deploying troops to American cities.

“It won't happen. It’s not going to happen. We would reject it. We would push back against that,” Newsom said
https://t.co/Q3ERDZJYaS

name: politico
text:
Opinion: Arson and looting are a perennial feature of urban unrest, but they have been pretty universally condemned for decades now—until the last week or so

https://t.co/xTZPuqQwzG

name: politico
text:
As election results across the country rolled in on Tuesday evening, current and former aides to Bernie Sanders abruptly laced into each other on social media, trading accusations of being “tone-deaf” and even stealing infrastructure from the 2020 campaign
https://t.co/3TcjXuWuuQ

name: politico
text:
The House Judiciary Committee will hold a hearing on police brutality on June 10 as Nancy Pelosi and Democratic leaders push to have a police reform package on the floor by the end of the month

https://t.co/m5CnjR7f0A

name: politico
text:
California Gov. Gavin Newsom is pushing to parlay short-term federal pandemic relief into a long-term remedy for the state's homelessness crisis by buying vacant hotels and turning them into permanent housing

https://t.co/LWB9xqUyhi

name: politico
text:
